name: 2oppcbas
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(coppc, c1)))
-| wceq(cfv(coppc, c1), cfv(coppc, c1))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 =(Base `(oppCat ` c1))
⊣ (oppCat ` c1)=(oppCat ` c1)
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(coppc, c1)))
-| wceq(cfv(coppc, c1), cfv(coppc, c1))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c1))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 =(Base `(oppCat ` c1))
⊣ (oppCat ` c1)=(oppCat ` c1)
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(coppc, c1)))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c1))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c1))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(coppc, c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 =(Base ` c1)
⊣ c1 =(oppCat ` c2)
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(coppc, c1)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(coppc, c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 =(Base `(oppCat ` c1))
⊣ c1 =(oppCat ` c2)
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c2)

comment: The double opposite category has the same objects as the original category. Intended for use with property lemmas such as ~ monpropd . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
